lom:description.lom:string: "For decades, undergraduate women have been moving in ever greater numbers into science and engineering departments at American universities. Yet even as they approach or exceed enrollment parity in mathematics, biology and other fields, there is one area in which their presence relative to men is static or even shrinking: computer science. Women received about 38 percent of the computer science bachelorÂ’s degrees awarded in the United States in 1985, the peak year, but in 2003, the figure was only about 28 percent, according to the National Science Foundation."

lom:keyword.lom:string: computing, computer science, gender, confidence, female, male, women, engage, teaching, classes, classroom

lom:title.lom:string: Computer science takes steps to bring women to the fold
